title: Multidimensional vulnerability index
text:
United Nations

General Assembly 
Distr.: Limited 
9 October 2025 
Original: English

*2516292* 
 
 
Eightieth session 
Second Committee 
Agenda item 18 (l) 
Sustainable development: multidimensional 
vulnerability index 
 
 
 
 
 
Palau:* draft resolution 
 
 
 
 Multidimensional vulnerability index 
 
 
 
The General Assembly,  
 
Recalling its resolution 78/322 of 13 August 2024,  
 
1. 
Expresses deep concern that the secretariat of the multidimensional 
vulnerability index has not presented a triennial report to the General Assembly at its 
eightieth session, under the relevant agenda sub-item in accordance with the 
provisions set out in paragraph 10 of its resolution 78/322;  
 
2. 
Also expresses deep concern that the relevant existing United Nations entity, 
which will act as the secretariat of the multidimensional vulnerability index, and the 
members of the Independent Expert Advisory Panel had not been appointed by the 
Secretary-General by the end of the seventy-ninth session of the General Assembly in 
accordance with the provisions set out in paragraph 11 of its resolution 78/322;  
 
3. 
Requests the Secretary-General, in consultation with Member States, to 
appoint the members of the Independent Expert Advisory Panel by no later than the 
end of 2025, and the relevant existing United Nations entity, which will act as the 
secretariat of the multidimensional vulnerability index, by no later than the end of the 
first quarter of 2026;  
 
4. 
Also requests the Secretary-General to ensure the full implementation of 
the relevant provisions of its resolution 78/322 and that adequate resources are 
available to support the work on the multidimensional vulnerability index;  
 
5. 
Decides to include in the provisional agenda of its eighty-third session, 
under the item entitled “Sustainable development”, the sub-item entitled 
“Multidimensional vulnerability index”, which will be considered triennially. 
 
 
 
* On behalf of the States Members of the United Nations that are members of the Alliance of 
Small Island States.
